page.title: 02ATTITUDES
page.content: Golfers at Fairthorne Manor's course were asked for their opinions of the course. They thought that the course was second rate and could be improved drastically. One golfer said that dogs should either work or be looked after properly. Another said that dogs should either work or roam free, so that the money spent on meat for dogs could be sent to starving countries. One golfer expressed his opinions on nuclear war, saying it was horrific to think about, but he would rather die than survive after a nuclear war. He said nuclear war was a waste of money. We should be using natural resources and experimenting to do greater things with materials like water.
